column4: Hi im trying to boot the ubuntu live disc but it always freezes at the same point just as it loads the top and bottom bars i dont know if it is to do with the fact i have my hdd connected to a ite IT8212 ide slot
try some of the boot options sugested on ubotu link page
Is that the command because i think that thing you typed was meant to get the bot to send me something but i didn't recieve anything
it must be death... run « lsb_release -a » on a terminal
Oh, so what do i do if i want to change my X configuration?
you can cretae one if you must. try « gksudo Xorg -configure »
Will that auto configure the driver or should i reboot?
Ok I see, I thought memory was handled slightly differently in linux, so should I be alright giving my vm 2gb of memory or not?
ubuntu should work with 2 GiB of free ram just fine (depending on what you do )
